clinical_study.brief_title: SEAL Registry - European Registry for the Effectiveness of LifeSeal® Kit
clinical_study.official_title: SEAL Registry - Observational, Retrospective and Prospective, One Arm, Registry Study for the Effectiveness of LifeSeal® Kit on Anastomotic Leaks in Patients Undergoing Low and Ultralow Anterior Resection

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the effectiveness of commercially available LifeSeal® Kit as measured by the incidence of post-operative clinical anastomotic leak rates in subjects undergoing low and ultralow anterior resection with an anastomosis. All patients treated with LifeSeal® will be offered to participate

detailed_description.textblock: The LifeSeal® Kit is a novel surgical sealant intended to be used as an adjunct to suture or staple line during standard surgical repair of the GI tract (anastomosis or linear) to provide re-inforcement and help reduce leaks. The LifeSeal™ Kit has recently been CE certified on March 2016 for marketing in the European Union.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of post-operative clinical anastomotic leaks at discharge
primary_outcome.time_frame: discharge from hospital 3-14 days post surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of post-operative clinical anastomotic leaks up to 4 weeks post-surgery

arm_group.description: creation of a coloanal or colorectal anastomosis

intervention.description: used as an adjunct to suture or staple line during standard surgical repair of the GI tract (anastomosis or linear) to provide re-inforcement and help reduce leaks.

study_pop.textblock: All patients who are treated with LifeSeal® and comply with the eligibility criteria will be offered to participate in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. ≥ 18 years of age at screening visit
2. Written informed consent obtained
3. Subject is scheduled to have or already underwent elective open, laparoscopic or robot assisted surgery involving the creation of a coloanal or colorectal anastomosis* created within 15 cm from the anal verge.
4. Subject was already treated or is scheduled to be treated with LifeSeal® Kit, applied according to the IFU
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject with American Society of Anesthesiology (ASA) status > 3.
